casebody.data:
William H. JACKSON, Appellant, v. W. H. HIATT, Warden, United States Penitentiary, Atlanta, Georgia, Appellee. No. 12678. United States Court of Appeals Fifth Circuit. April 15, 1949. No appearance for appellant. J. Ellis Mundy, U. S. Atty., and Harvey H. Tisinger, Asst. U. S. Atty., both of Atlanta, Ga., and Eugene M. Caffey, Col., J. A. G. D., Hq. 3rd Army, and H. M. Peyton, Lt. Col., both of Fort McPherson, Ga., for appellee.

Before HOLMES, McCORD, and WALLER, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

The judgment of the district court denying the application for a writ of habeas corpus and dismissing the petition is hereby affirmed.1

Jackson v. Hiatt, 5 Cir., 170 F.2d 630.
